entry.title: Marie Litta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Marie Litta (pictured) started her own opera company in her early 20s, just a few years before her death in 1883?

entry.title: economy of Sarawak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the economy of Sarawak is strongly dependent on natural resource exports such as timber, oil, and gas?

entry.title: G. D. Sweet Famous Players (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that not so much as a "hell" or "damn" was permitted at G. D. Sweet Famous Players' "Sunday school" productions?

entry.title: pushbacks of migrants in Greece (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Frontex's role in pushbacks of migrants in Greece has led to investigations by the European Parliament, EU Ombudsman, and EU anti-fraud agency?

entry.title: Nerds 2.0.1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the documentary Nerds 2.0.1 has been criticized for racial inequality among its 50 featured pioneers of the internet?

entry.title: Hans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Franco-Belgian comic book Hans had its title changed in Poland due to lingering ill-feeling toward Germany?

entry.title: Galac-Tac (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Galac-Tac, launched in 1982 as a play-by-mail game, is still available today for play on the web?

entry.title: The Oxford Illustrated History of Medieval Europe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Oxford Illustrated History of Medieval Europe isn't a book that perhaps cannot be written?
